alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and south central Broward Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 445 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Miccosukee Resort, or 14 miles west of Kendall, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Gardens, The Redland, Doral, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, Medley, Fountainbleau, Kendale Lakes, Palm Springs North, Country Club, Pennsuco, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, The Hammocks and Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
